title: Verify the report printing with bundled Chrome PDF viewer

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Pre-requisite:

Operating System: Windows 7 32-Bit or Window 8.1 64-Bit. 
Make sure version of Chrome is 36.0.19585.125M.
Enable the bundled Chrome PDF viewer and Disable Adobe PDF plugin.
[Click on the button that has 3 horizontal lines and then choose Settings. 
Click on ?Show advanced settings?? at the bottom of the screen.
Under the Privacy section, choose ?Content settings??.
Under Plug-ins, choose ?Disable individual plug-ins??.
(plugin will be shown in grey when disabled)
Click Enable under the Chrome PDF Viewer Plugin. 
Disable Adobe Reader.]
2. Login to the PV application using valid credentials
3. Navigate to Reports portal.
4. 1.Choose any PDF report such as the Single Event Audit.
2.Choose  any event as criteria
3.Click View Report
5. Click the print icon.
6. Close the preview screen
7. Verify the scenario in both Operating System: Windows 7 32-Bit and Window 8.1 64-Bit.
Repeat the above steps
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. 
2. The user should be logged in successfully
3. Reports portal should be displayed.
4. The report will be displayed.
5. The print preview screen should appear for preview of report . (Should not display error message like "Aw, Snap!")
Should be able to print within Chrome using the Chrome PDF viewer without getting an error message.
6. PV Reports page should appear. (Should not display error message like "Aw, Snap!")
7. Should be able to print within Chrome using the Chrome PDF viewer without getting an error message.

2. Run should be start successfully

4. Rollover config should be created successfully
5. The user should be able to configure the source and navigate to the configuration page.
6. Validation should be successful.
7. The Validation should be successful
8. Some errors should be encountered
9. Rollover Error Report is launched successfully

title: Verify whether non datamart report - Order Digest by Agency Report - generates an error message when the data collection is timed out

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Perform event transaction with a patron P1.
Note down the transaction date.
2. Login to application using valid username and password.
3. Navigate to System Administration- > Application Properties tab.
4. Search for applicaton property  "report.default.data.collection.time.out.seconds".
5. Edit the value of the "report.default.data.collection.time.out.seconds" to 10 seconds.
6. Naviagte to Reports Portal and select 'Payment Summary Report'.
7. Enter the parameters like Supplier of the performed transaction etc, that takes longer time in data collection.

Generate report
8. Verify if the report takes more than 10 second, a warning message on the screen is displayed:

"The execution time for this report has exceeded the maximum execution time allowed. Change the parameter values to reduce the number of records that will be returned."
9. Navigate to System Admin portal -> Application property ""report.onsale.data.collection.time.out.seconds to 5 sec. 

Repeat the step 6 to 8. (Re-run the same report with same parameter).
10. Naviagate to System Admin portal -> Application property

Set the below properties to 0 (zero) 
"report.onsale.data.collection.time.out.seconds"  
"report.default.data.collection.time.out.seconds"

Repeat the step 6 to 8. (Re-run the same report with same parameter).
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. The event transaction must be completed successfully.
2. The user should be able to login to the application
3. Application Properties page is loaded.
4. The default value of property "report.default.data.collection.time.out.seconds" is 0(zero).
5. The applicaton property   "report.default.data.collection.time.out.seconds" is set to 10 seconds.
6. User should be able to select the Report
7. The report must be generated successfully.
8. The warning message should be displayed correctly, if report is not generated with in 10 seconds.
9. The same warning message should be displayed if the report is not generated with in 5 seconds.

"The execution time for this report has exceeded the maximum execution time allowed. Change the parameter values to reduce the number of records that will be returned."
10. The report should be displayed with out any warning message.

custom_steps_separated.content:

title: Verify that while running PTH reports submission timeout is increased upto 60 minutes.

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Prerequisite:
1. Run the following query,

SELECT COUNT(ticket.ticket_id),financial_patron_account_id 
FROM pvqaf02.patron_order 
INNER JOIN pvqaf02.ticket on ticket.order_id = patron_order.order_id
GROUP BY financial_patron_account_id 
ORDER BY COUNT(ticket.ticket_id) DESC;

2. Take Patron# with maximum ticket count and used the same for executing the PTH Reports.
2. set the report.default.data.collection.time.out.seconds application property to 0
3. Taken the Patron and ran PTH reports with the following date range ? 12/5/1900 ? 12/5/2016.
4. Try executing the following reports with patron having max ticket count.
Patron Transaction Detail Report
Patron Transaction Export Report
Patron Transaction Summary Report
5. Verify the error message after 60 mins.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. precondition executed successfully.
2. application property value set successfully.
3. Input paramenetre should be entered.
4. 
5. User should get ?* Unspecified error.? after 60 mins.
